pr_title: [2.26.x] Improve audit logs for authentication and session events

timeline.message: Audit login success/failure and session creation
Audit logout events for all users and fix auditing of invalid session ids

timeline.bodyText: Made this fail the bundle so we actually see an error if session auditing stops working. Last time session auditing stopped working and nobody noticed (it's been broken since this change in 2018 #3783)
timeline.author: SmithJosh

timeline.bodyText:
I couldn't find a better way to inject the SecurityLogger service into this class. This class is created by Jetty via jetty.xml so not managed by blueprint. I tried CDI but couldn't get it working.
This made things a little weird for the unit test for this class, too, which starts up a Jetty server (not OSGi). The BundleContext injection is a little ugly, but couldn't find a better way to make things work. Open to suggestions if anybody has any.
timeline.author: SmithJosh

timeline.bodyText: Registering this as a service doesn't work because of a limitation in Pax Web. See https://ops4j1.jira.com/browse/PAXWEB-1123. If we wanted to use an HttpSessionListener for all servlet contexts, we'd have to inject it the same way we do error pages, which is a bit of a hack. So I opted to audit from the AttributeSharingHashSessionIdManager
timeline.author: SmithJosh

timeline.message: Fix audited subject name for PKI logout
